facts.fact: 15 Million More People Would Be Uninsured under TrumpCare in 2018, Climbing to 22 Million by 2026
The Uninsured Rate Would Be Higher under TrumpCare for All Ages and Incomes by 2026
TrumpCare Cuts Would Result in 15 Million People Losing Medicaid by 2026
TrumpCare Medicaid Cuts Would Deepen Over Time, Forcing Even Greater Coverage and Benefit Reductions
Over 200,000 People Could Die From Becoming Uninsured under TrumpCare
People Would Pay 74 Percent More for the Same Marketplace Plan Under TrumpCare by 2020 (Includes State and County Estimates)
Comparing Apples-to-Apples, Premiums Would Rise by 9 Percent in 2026 under TrumpCare
Out-of-Pocket Costs for Older Americans Would Be At Least $5,000 More under TrumpCare by 2026
facts.sourceName: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

facts.fact: Under TrumpCare, Deductibles Would Rise by about $2,500, and Even More for Low-Income Marketplace Enrollees
TrumpCare Would Cut Health Care Programs to Pay for $563 BIllion in Tax Breaks for Corporations and the Wealthy
facts.sourceName: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities

facts.fact: 13 Million Would Become Uninsured by 2022 Due to a Roll-Back of the Medicaid Expansion Under TrumpCare
2 Million Children, 283,000 People with Disabilities, and 569,000 Other Adults Would Become Uninsured in 2022 Due to TrumpCare's Medicaid Cap
Federal Marketplace Financial Assistance Would Be Cut by 84 Percent in 2022 Under TrumpCare
Health Insurance Premiums Would Climb by 20 Percent in 2018 Under TrumpCare (Includes County Estimates)
27 Million Americans with Employer Health Benefits Could Be Subject to Annual and Lifetime Limits on Coverage Under TrumpCare (Includes State Estimates)
21 Million Could Be Locked Out of Coverage Due to a Break in Coverage Under TrumpCare
TrumpCare Would Provide 45 Percent of Tax Benefits to the Wealthiest One Percent
TrumpCare Would Cut Funding for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) by 12 Percent
TrumpCare Would Cut Three-Quarters of a Trillion Dollars from Medicaid, Nearly the Same As Every Dime of Marketplace Subsidies from 2018 to 2026
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of Uninsured Young Adults (Ages 19-34) by Two-Thirds in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of Uninsured Older Americans (Ages 55-64) by 85 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of Low-Income (<138 Percent of Poverty) Uninsured by 72 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of Hispanic Uninsured by 40 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of African American Uninsured by 73 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of Asian American / Pacific Islander Uninsured by 98 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of American Indian / Alaskan Native Uninsured by 73 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
TrumpCare Would Increase the Number of High-Income (>400 Percent of Poverty) Uninsured by 241 Percent in 2022 (Includes State Estimates)
By 2026, 1.45 Million Jobs Would Be Lost Due to TrumpCare
